<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 265, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Theory (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 383, 359, 399]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(10 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 603, 220, 618]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 619, 730, 651]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

Ncm [3] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 503, 146, 521]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 503, 920, 535]]<|/det|> The moment in **(a)** does not release the wheel nut. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
Fig. 10.1 shows a metal kettle used for heating water. The kettle is connected to the mains power supply. The metal case is connected to earth. A fault causes the live wire to come loose and touch the metal case, as shown.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 139, 834, 317]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 345, 537, 364]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 377, 180, 396]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 377, 834, 396]]<|/det|>
The kettle is switched on. There is a very large electric current in the live wire.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 408, 663, 427]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 501, 181, 520]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 625, 920, 658]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 705, 920, 722]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 733, 146, 752]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 733, 623, 752]]<|/det|>
The current in a device when operating normally is 3.1A.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 764, 440, 782]]<|/det|>
State a suitable value for the fuse.
